conll_line2match()[source]¶
conll_pattern = re.compile('(?P<id>\\d+)((?:\\.)?(?P<hidden>\\d+))? # i (as well es hidden node-ids in conll-u format)\n \\t(?P<text>.*?) \n \\t(?P<lemma>., re.VERBOSE)¶
doc2conll()[source]¶
dump(sentence_df, filename)[source]¶
export_parses(sentence_df)[source]¶
import_parses(df)[source]¶

import parse tree information like head and dep_ from a directory containing conll-files, that have the ‘sentence_id’ as filename and ‘conll’ as suffix. These files can be produced by GrammarAnnotator.export_parses # conll editor: https://arborator.ilpga.fr/q.cgi

grammarannotator.df2tuples(df)[source]¶
grammarannotator.split_data_frame_list(df, target_column)[source]¶

Splits a column with lists into rows

Keyword arguments:
df – dataframe target_column – name of column that contains lists
grammarannotator.split_data_frame_list_beware(df, target_column)[source]¶

Accepts a column with multiple types and splits list variables to several rows.

df: dataframe to split target_column: the column containing the values to split output_type: type of all outputs returns: a dataframe with each entry for the target column separated, with each element moved into a new row. The values in the other columns are duplicated across the newly divided rows.
